BitField.Name: VERSION[31:0]
BitField.Notes: Version number. Unique to all cores. Default value: 0x00000000

BitField.Name: ID[31:0]
BitField.Notes: Instance identifier number. Default value: 0x00000000

BitField.Name: SCRATCH[31:0]
BitField.Notes: Scratch register. Default value: 0x00000000

BitField.Name: IQCORRECTION_DISABLE
BitField.Notes: If set, indicates that the IQ Correction module was not implemented. (as a result of a configuration of the IP instance) Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: DCFILTER_DISABLE
BitField.Notes: If set, indicates that the DC Filter module was not implemented. (as a result of a configuration of the IP instance) Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: DATAFORMAT_DISABLE
BitField.Notes: If set, indicates that the Data Format module was not implemented. (as a result of a configuration of the IP instance) Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: USERPORTS_DISABLE
BitField.Notes: If set, indicates that the logic related to the User Data Format (e.g. decimation) was not implemented. (as a result of a configuration of the IP instance) Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: MODE_1R1T
BitField.Notes: If set, indicates that the core was implemented in 1 channel mode. (e.g. refer to AD9361 data sheet) Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: DELAY_CONTROL_DISABLE
BitField.Notes: If set, indicates that the delay control is disabled for this IP. (as a result of a configuration of the IP instance) Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: DDS_DISABLE
BitField.Notes: If set, indicates that the DDS is disabled for this IP. (as a result of a configuration of the IP instance) Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: CMOS_OR_LVDS_N
BitField.Notes: CMOS or LVDS mode is used for the interface. (as a result of a configuration of the IP instance) Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: PPS_RECEIVER_ENABLE
BitField.Notes: If set, indicates the PPS receiver is enabled. (as a result of a configuration of the IP instance) Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: SCALECORRECTION_ONLY
BitField.Notes: If set, indicates that the IQ Correction module implements only scale correction. IQ correction must be enabled. (as a result of a configuration of the IP instance) Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: PPS_IRQ_MASK
BitField.Notes: Mask bit for the 1PPS receiver interrupt Default value: 0x1

Register.Name: REG_FPGA_INFO
Register.Description: FPGA device information [[https://github.com/analogdevicesinc/hdl/blob/master/library/scripts/adi_intel_device_info_enc.tcl |Intel encoded values]] [[https://github.com/analogdevicesinc/hdl/blob/master/library/scripts/adi_xilinx_device_info_enc.tcl |Xilinx encoded values]] (REG_FPGA_INFO)

BitField.Name: FPGA_TECHNOLOGY
BitField.Notes: Encoded value describing the technology/generation of the FPGA device (arria 10/7series) Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: FPGA_FAMILY
BitField.Notes: Encoded value describing the family variant of the FPGA device(e.g., SX, GX, GT or zynq, kintex, virtex) Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: SPEED_GRADE
BitField.Notes: Encoded value describing the FPGA's speed-grade Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: DEV_PACKAGE
BitField.Notes: Encoded value describing the device package. The package might affect high-speed interfaces Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: CE_N
BitField.Notes: Clock enable, default is enabled(0x0). An inverse version of the signal is exported out of the module to control clock enables Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: MMCM_RSTN
BitField.Notes: MMCM reset only (required for DRP access). Reset, default is IN-RESET (0x0), software must write 0x1 to bring up the core. Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: RSTN
BitField.Notes: Reset, default is IN-RESET (0x0), software must write 0x1 to bring up the core. Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: SYNC
BitField.Notes: Setting this bit synchronizes channels within a DAC, and across multiple instances. This bit self clears. Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: PAR_TYPE
BitField.Notes: Select parity even (0x0) or odd (0x1). Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: PAR_ENB
BitField.Notes: Select parity (0x1) or frame (0x0) mode. Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: R1_MODE
BitField.Notes: Select number of RF channels 1 (0x1) or 2 (0x0). Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: DATA_FORMAT
BitField.Notes: Select data format 2's complement (0x0) or offset binary (0x1). NOT-APPLICABLE if DAC_DP_DISABLE is set (0x1). Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: RESERVED[3:0]
BitField.Notes: Reserved Default value: 0x00

BitField.Name: RATE[7:0]
BitField.Notes: The effective dac rate (the maximum possible rate is dependent on the interface clock). The samples are generated at 1/RATE of the interface clock. Default value: 0x00

BitField.Name: FRAME
BitField.Notes: The use of frame is device specific. Usually setting this bit to 1 generates a FRAME (1 DCI clock period) pulse on the interface. This bit self clears. Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: CLK_FREQ[31:0]
BitField.Notes: Interface clock frequency. This is relative to the processor clock and in many cases is 100MHz. The number is represented as unsigned 16.16 format. Assuming a 100MHz processor clock the minimum is 1.523kHz and maximum is 6.554THz. The actual interface clock is CLK_FREQ * CLK_RATIO (see below). Note that the actual sampling clock may not be the same as the interface clock- software must consider device specific implementation parameters to calculate the final sampling clock. Default value: 0x00000000

BitField.Name: CLK_RATIO[31:0]
BitField.Notes: Interface clock ratio - as a factor actual received clock. This is implementation specific and depends on any serial to parallel conversion and interface type (ddr/sdr/qdr). Default value: 0x00000000

BitField.Name: STATUS
BitField.Notes: Interface status, if set indicates no errors. If not set, there are errors, software may try resetting the cores. Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: DAC_CLKSEL
BitField.Notes: Allows changing of the clock polarity. Note: its default value is CLK_EDGE_SEL Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: DRP_RWN
BitField.Notes: DRP read (0x1) or write (0x0) select (does not include GTX lanes). NOT-APPLICABLE if DRP_DISABLE is set (0x1). Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: DRP_ADDRESS[11:0]
BitField.Notes: DRP address, designs that contain more than one DRP accessible primitives have selects based on the most significant bits (does not include GTX lanes). NOT-APPLICABLE if DRP_DISABLE is set (0x1). Default value: 0x00

BitField.Name: RESERVED[15:0]
BitField.Notes: Reserved for backwards compatibility Default value: 0x0000

BitField.Name: DRP_LOCKED
BitField.Notes: If set indicates the MMCM/PLL is locked Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: DRP_STATUS
BitField.Notes: If set indicates busy (access pending). The read data may not be valid if this bit is set (does not include GTX lanes). NOT-APPLICABLE if DRP_DISABLE is set (0x1). Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: RESERVED[15:0]
BitField.Notes: Reserved for backwards compatibility Default value: 0x0000

BitField.Name: DRP_WDATA[15:0]
BitField.Notes: DRP write data (does not include GTX lanes). NOT-APPLICABLE if DRP_DISABLE is set (0x1). Default value: 0x0000

BitField.Name: DRP_RDATA
BitField.Notes: DRP read data (does not include GTX lanes). NOT-APPLICABLE if DRP_DISABLE is set (0x1). Default value: 0x0000

BitField.Name: UI_OVF
BitField.Notes: User Interface overflow. If set, indicates an overflow occurred during data transfer at the user interface (FIFO interface). Software must write a 0x1 to clear this register bit. Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: UI_UNF
BitField.Notes: User Interface underflow. If set, indicates an underflow occurred during data transfer at the user interface (FIFO interface). Software must write a 0x1 to clear this register bit. Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: USR_CHANMAX[7:0]
BitField.Notes: This indicates the maximum number of inputs for the channel data multiplexers. User may add different processing modules as inputs to the dac. NOT-APPLICABLE if USERPORTS_DISABLE is set (0x1). Default value: 0x00

BitField.Name: DAC_GPIO_IN[31:0]
BitField.Notes: This reads auxiliary GPI pins of the DAC core Default value: 0x00000000

BitField.Name: DAC_GPIO_OUT[31:0]
BitField.Notes: This controls auxiliary GPO pins of the DAC core NOT-APPLICABLE if GPIO_DISABLE is set (0x1). Default value: 0x00000000

BitField.Name: PROFILE_SEL
BitField.Notes: Selects one of the available deframer/framers from the transport layer. Valid only if ''PROFILE_NUM'' > 1.

BitField.Name: PROFILE_NUM
BitField.Notes: Number of supported framer/deframer profiles.

BitField.Name: JESD_F
BitField.Notes: Octets per Frame per Lane.

BitField.Name: JESD_S
BitField.Notes: Samples per Converter per Frame.

BitField.Name: JESD_L
BitField.Notes: Lane Count.

BitField.Name: JESD_M
BitField.Notes: Converter Count.

BitField.Name: JESD_N
BitField.Notes: Converter Resolution.

BitField.Name: JESD_NP
BitField.Notes: Total Number of Bits per Sample.

BitField.Name: DDS_SCALE_1[15:0]
BitField.Notes: The DDS scale for tone 1. Defines the amplitude of the tone. The format is 1.1.14 fixed point (signed, integer, fractional). The DDS in general runs on 16-bits, note that if you do use both channels and set both scale to 0x4000, it is over-range. The final output is (channel_1_fullscale * scale_1) + (channel_2 * scale_2). NOT-APPLICABLE if DDS_DISABLE is set (0x1). Default value: 0x0000

BitField.Name: DDS_INIT_1[15:0]
BitField.Notes: The DDS phase initialization for tone 1. Defines the initial phase offset of the tone. NOT-APPLICABLE if DDS_DISABLE is set (0x1). Default value: 0x0000

BitField.Name: DDS_INCR_1[15:0]
BitField.Notes: Defines the resolution of the phase accumulator. Its value can be defined by <m>INCR = (f_out * 2^16) * clkratio / f_if</m>; where f_out is the generated output frequency, and f_if is the frequency of the digital interface, and clock_ratio is the ratio between the sampling clock and the interface clock. NOT-APPLICABLE if DDS_DISABLE is set (0x1). Default value: 0x0000

BitField.Name: DDS_SCALE_2[15:0]
BitField.Notes: The DDS scale for tone 1. Defines the amplitude of the tone. The format is 1.1.14 fixed point (signed, integer, fractional). The DDS in general runs on 16-bits, note that if you do use both channels and set both scale to 0x4000, it is over-range. The final output is (channel_1_fullscale * scale_1) + (channel_2 * scale_2). NOT-APPLICABLE if DDS_DISABLE is set (0x1). Default value: 0x0000

BitField.Name: DDS_INIT_2[15:0]
BitField.Notes: The DDS phase initialization for tone 1. Defines the initial phase offset of the tone. NOT-APPLICABLE if DDS_DISABLE is set (0x1). Default value: 0x0000

BitField.Name: DDS_INCR_2[15:0]
BitField.Notes: Defines the resolution of the phase accumulator. Its value can be defined by <m>INCR = (f_out * 2^16) * clkratio / f_if</m>; where f_out is the generated output frequency, and f_if is the frequency of the digital interface, and clock_ratio is the ratio between the sampling clock and the interface clock. NOT-APPLICABLE if DDS_DISABLE is set (0x1). Default value: 0x0000

BitField.Name: DDS_PATT_2[15:0]
BitField.Notes: The DDS data pattern for this channel. Default value: 0x0000

BitField.Name: DDS_PATT_1[15:0]
BitField.Notes: The DDS data pattern for this channel. Default value: 0x0000

BitField.Name: IQCOR_ENB
BitField.Notes: if set, enables IQ correction. NOT-APPLICABLE if DAC_DP_DISABLE is set (0x1). Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: DAC_LB_OWR
BitField.Notes: If set, forces DAC_DDS_SEL to 0x8, loopback If DAC_LB_OWR and DAC_PN_OWR are both set, they are ignored Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: DAC_PN_OWR
BitField.Notes: IF set, forces DAC_DDS_SEL to 0x09, device specific pnX If DAC_LB_OWR and DAC_PN_OWR are both set, they are ignored Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: DAC_DDS_SEL[3:0]
BitField.Notes: Select internal data sources (available only if the DAC supports it). \\ - 0x00: internal tone (DDS) \\ - 0x01: pattern (SED) \\ - 0x02: input data (DMA) \\ - 0x03: 0x00 \\ - 0x04: inverted pn7 \\ - 0x05: inverted pn15 \\ - 0x06: pn7 (standard O.150) \\ - 0x07: pn15 (standard O.150) \\ - 0x08: loopback data (ADC) \\ - 0x09: pnX (Device specific e.g. ad9361) \\ - 0x0A: Nibble ramp (Device specific e.g. adrv9001) \\ - 0x0B: 16 bit ramp (Device specific e.g. adrv9001) \\ Default value: 0x00

BitField.Name: IQCOR_COEFF_1[15:0]
BitField.Notes: IQ correction (if equipped) coefficient. If scale & offset is implemented, this is the scale value and the format is 1.1.14 (sign, integer and fractional bits). If matrix multiplication is used, this is the channel I coefficient and the format is 1.1.14 (sign, integer and fractional bits). NOT-APPLICABLE if IQCORRECTION_DISABLE is set (0x1). Default value: 0x0000

BitField.Name: IQCOR_COEFF_2[15:0]
BitField.Notes: IQ correction (if equipped) coefficient. If scale & offset is implemented, this is the offset value and the format is 2's complement. If matrix multiplication is used, this is the channel Q coefficient and the format is 1.1.14 (sign, integer and fractional bits). NOT-APPLICABLE if IQCORRECTION_DISABLE is set (0x1). Default value: 0x0000

BitField.Name: USR_DATATYPE_BE
BitField.Notes: The user data type format- if set, indicates big endian (default is little endian). NOT-APPLICABLE if USERPORTS_DISABLE is set (0x1). Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: USR_DATATYPE_SIGNED
BitField.Notes: The user data type format- if set, indicates signed (2's complement) data (default is unsigned). NOT-APPLICABLE if USERPORTS_DISABLE is set (0x1). Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: USR_DATATYPE_SHIFT[7:0]
BitField.Notes: The user data type format- the amount of right shift for actual samples within the total number of bits. NOT-APPLICABLE if USERPORTS_DISABLE is set (0x1). Default value: 0x00

BitField.Name: USR_DATATYPE_TOTAL_BITS[7:0]
BitField.Notes: The user data type format- number of total bits used for a sample. The total number of bits must be an integer multiple of 8 (byte aligned). NOT-APPLICABLE if USERPORTS_DISABLE is set (0x1). Default value: 0x00

BitField.Name: USR_DATATYPE_BITS[7:0]
BitField.Notes: The user data type format- number of bits in a sample. This indicates the actual sample data bits. NOT-APPLICABLE if USERPORTS_DISABLE is set (0x1). Default value: 0x00

BitField.Name: USR_INTERPOLATION_M[15:0]
BitField.Notes: This holds the user interpolation M value of the channel that is currently being selected on the multiplexer above. The total interpolation factor is of the form M/N. NOT-APPLICABLE if USERPORTS_DISABLE is set (0x1). Default value: 0x0000

BitField.Name: USR_INTERPOLATION_N[15:0]
BitField.Notes: This holds the user interpolation N value of the channel that is currently being selected on the multiplexer above. The total interpolation factor is of the form M/N. NOT-APPLICABLE if USERPORTS_DISABLE is set (0x1). Default value: 0x0000

BitField.Name: DAC_IQ_MODE[0]
BitField.Notes: Enable complex mode. In this mode the driven data to the DAC must be a sequence of I and Q sample pairs. Default value: 0x0

BitField.Name: DAC_IQ_SWAP[1]
BitField.Notes: Allows IQ swapping in complex mode. Only takes effect if complex mode is enabled. Default value: 0x0
